  battlesys.Player

public abstract class Player
extends java.lang.Object

Class for storing general data and moves for a player TODO implements Serializable...

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

Player

public Player()
Constructor initializing the player data It should be noted that boughtAtk 0 - 2 must store the 3 basic attacks, BasicAtk, AimedAtk and StrongAtk, respectively. All players must first call this constructor before giving their own point allocation

Method Detail

loadTournamentData

public static final int loadTournamentData()
Load the allowed points to allocate from the file "tournamentPoints.txt". If loading fails, a file will be created, and the default value (DEFAULT_PLAYER_POINTS) will be returned

Returns:

useMove

protected final CompleteMoveResult useMove(java.lang.String name,
                                           PlayerList thisSide,
                                           PlayerList opposingSide)
                                    throws BattleSysException
Use a move with a given name. The target will be chosen randomly.

Parameters:
name - The name (short class name) of the attack
thisSide - The players in own side
opposingSide - The players in other side
Returns:
MoveResult for the move actually used
Throws:
BattleSysException - Thrown when the code is invalid or the move is not owned by player

deadSpeech

protected void deadSpeech()
Do speeches when this player hp less than zero. To be overriden.

move

protected CompleteMoveResult move(PlayerList thisPlayers,
                                  PlayerList opposingPlayers,
                                  int round,
                                  int battleNo,
                                  RandomEventResult reResult,
                                  java.util.List<SingleMoveResult> mResult)
                           throws BattleSysException
Do a player move.

Parameters:
thisPlayers - Player data of all players in the same team
opposingPlayers - Player data of all the opposing players
round - The number of round it has been
battleNo - How many battles have been played for this player from the beginning of this replay
reResult - Random Event Result of the last Random event
mResult - The result of the opponent's last move
Returns:
List of Move Results returned by the useMove method
Throws:
BattleSysException

setAtkName

protected final void setAtkName(java.lang.String className,
                                java.lang.String name)
                         throws BattleSysException
Set the name of the attack specific to the player. Set the same name of the critical, so if you want to set the special critical name, call this first before setting the critical name! Otherwise the name you set will be overwritten.

Parameters:
className - The short class name for the move
name - Name to be set. This name will be shown in the reports
Throws:
BattleSysException - Thrown when the move specified by className does not exist, or the player does not own the move

setCritName

protected final void setCritName(java.lang.String className,
                                 java.lang.String name)
                          throws BattleSysException
Set the name of the critical attack specific to the player

Parameters:
className - The short class name for the move
name - Name to be set. This name will be shown in the reports
Throws:
BattleSysException - Thrown when the move specified by className does not exist, or the player does not own the move

getREEffect

public final int getREEffect(int quality)
Get the value difference between the current value and actual value (including ability-changing moves). The difference due to random events.

Parameters:
quality - Quality of the player affected, one of the AFFECT_ATK, AFFECT_DEF, AFFECT_SPD, AFFECT_MOR.
Returns:
positive value difference if the player has been positively affected by random events, negative in contrast. If no such effect zero is returned.

battle

public static final SingleBattleResult battle(PlayerList t1,
                                              PlayerList t2,
                                              java.lang.String teamName1,
                                              java.lang.String teamName2,
                                              int battleNo,
                                              java.lang.String graphName)
                                       throws BattleSysException
Execute a battle, and shows the procedure and result

Parameters:
t1 - Player list of team 1
t2 - Player list of team 2
teamName1 - Name of team 1
teamName2 - Name of team 2
battleNo - Battle number (non-R1 only)
graphName - The name of the graph generated
Returns:
Battle result storing the winner, number of round played and the battle record
Throws:
BattleSysException
